title: 113_hr2866
content: The Act may be cited as the "Boys Town Centennial Commemorative Coin Act". Boys Town is a nonprofit organization founded in 1917 by Father Flanagan in Nebraska. It serves children of all races and religions, gained worldwide recognition after a movie in 1938, and expanded its reach globally after World War II. Boys Town, founded in 1917 by Father Flanagan in Nebraska, has expanded to 11 regions across the country, providing care to children and families. The Boys Town National Hotline offers counseling to over 150,000 callers annually, while the Boys Town National Research Hospital is a leader in hearing care and Usher Syndrome research. Their programs impact over 2,000,000 individuals each year, with the 100th anniversary of Boys Town approaching on December 12th, 2017. SEC. 3. COIN SPECIFICATIONS. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint and issue commemorative $5 gold coins, $1 silver coins, and half dollar clad coins in honor of the centennial of Father Flanagan's Boys Town. The coins will have specific weights, diameters, and metal compositions as outlined in the Act. The commemorative coins minted for the centennial of Father Flanagan's Boys Town will weigh 11.34 grams, have a diameter of 1.205 inches, and meet specifications for half dollar coins. They will be legal tender and considered numismatic items. The design of the coins minted for the centennial of Boys Town will be emblematic of the organization's 100 years. The coins will feature a value designation, the year 2017, and inscriptions of "Liberty", "In God We Trust", "United States of America", and "E Pluribus Unum". The design will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with Boys Town's National Executive Director and the Commission of Fine Arts, and reviewed by the Citizens of Coinage Advisory Committee. Coins minted under this Act for the centennial of Boys Town will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities at a single United States Mint facility. The Secretary is authorized to issue these coins only between January 1, 2017, and December 31, 2017. The coins issued under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the face value plus the cost of designing and issuing the coins. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted with a reasonable discount. Surcharges will also be applied. SEC. 7. SURCHARGES. Sales of coins under this Act will include surcharges: $35 for $5 coin, $10 for $1 coin, $5 for half dollar coin. Surcharges received will be paid to Boys Town for their cause. SEC. 8. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. SEC. 8. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. The Secretary will ensure minting coins won't cost the government and no funds will be disbursed until all costs are recovered.
